Package conn

Class CloudToMongo

  • java.lang.Object
    • conn.CloudToMongo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
    public class CloudToMongo
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
    Reads the messages from the MQTT broker, "cleans"(formats) that message according to the sensor being used and inserts the message into the Mongo Client specified

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CloudToMongo()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String clean​(java.lang.String message)
      Cleans the message received from the sensor according to the sensor being used: for example if it has two double quotes and it should only have one, it returns it with one double quote only
      void connectionLost​(java.lang.Throwable cause)  
      void connectMongo()
      Connects to the Mongo Client according to the mongo host defined in the cloudToMongo.ini
      void connectMQTTBroker()
      Connects to the broker according to the cloud server and topic defined in the cloudToMongo.ini
      void deliveryComplete​(org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.IMqttDeliveryToken token)  
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Reads from the cloudToMongo.ini and starts the connections to the Broker and Mongo Client
      void messageArrived​(java.lang.String topic, org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttMessage c)

      • clean

        public java.lang.String clean​(java.lang.String message)
        Cleans the message received from the sensor according to the sensor being used: for example if it has two double quotes and it should only have one, it returns it with one double quote only
        Parameters:
        message - Message from sensor, unformatted
        Returns:
        Message from the sensor, clean and ready to be inserted into MongoDB
